features: Outsider Handle: Provides optimal capacity and a ﬂat packing surface inside to minimize wrinkling.
World's only one-touch CX expansion: increases packing capacity when you need more space. Simply press CX buttons and pull up sides to expand. Once ready, zip closed and push down to compress
Tri-Fold Garment Folder: With Foam roll bar neatly holds 1-2 suits and prevents wrinkling
Premium garment panels: envelop your clothing with minimal creasing
Discreet Features: Hide-away ID tag and SpeedThru pocket with orange lining visually informs you that the pocket is opened
body.description: The Briggs & Riley Medium Expandable Spinner Luggage (26" x 18" x 12") is perfect for 3-8 day trips. The integrated bottom fabric handle offers different ways to hold your luggage. Need more room? Our SmartLink™ strap allows you to comfortably transport 2 bags as one. Simply Attach the add-a-bag strap's T-bar to the docking base, then loop it through the handle for a second bag for convenience. This luggage also offers a large front pocket and 2 mesh lid zip pockets to optimize the use of space and additional storage for all your travel essentials. The premium garment panels envelop your clothing with minimal creasing. Cinching down the straps add compression, reducing shifting in transit. The high-density wheels offer superb smooth rolling. Encasing in impact resistant material to increase protection, while ensuring durability for countless miles. Designed with self-repairing YKK RC zippers call for smooth zipper action with lockable zipper pulls. Bag can be cleaned with a soft, damp cloth or an adhesive lint brush roller. If your bag is ever broken or damaged, we'll repair it free of charge, no proof of purchase needed, no questions asked.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Iconic Details Timeless, classic styling with quintessentially iconic details for life well traveled. Superior Materials Superior materials for a product that lasts a lifetime, so you can travel with confidence. Exceptionally Durable Remarkably strong ballistic nylon fabric resists wear providing expectational durability that endures the test of time. Shock Absorbing Wheels Spinner wheels offer 360° maneuverability and smooth quiet gliding for effortless navigation.

Increased Packing Capacity World's only one-touch CX expansion increases packing capacity when you need more space. Simply press CX buttons and pull up sides to expand. Optimal Capacity Patented and iconic, our Outsider handle provides optimal capacity and a ﬂat packing surface inside to minimize wrinkling. Minimal Creasing Premium extra wide garment panels envelop your clothing. Built-in-tri-fold Garment Folder With foam roll bar neatly holds 1-2 suits and prevents wrinkling.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite bag
reviews.reviewText: This is the 2nd Briggs & Riley spinner I have purchased. I had the older model of these which did a huge number of trips being a very regular international traveller. Love this bag. It outlived all my Rimowa bags. Its very tough and can take a lot of punishment. The wheels have lasted without any issues over about 10 years and probably 100+ trips. I really like the internal expansion system which easily adds a lot of capacity. Like the warranty too which gives piece of mind. Great buy and worth the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Olive Green 22inch Baseline carry on - incredible!!!
reviews.reviewText: I travel 4-10 new countries a year. Every year. I’m an avid traveler that goes from the soft streets of Amsterdam to cobblestone of Paris, to dirt streets of India, and this bag is just insanely nice. It’s SO well built I’m blown away. The photos make it look plain on amazing but it’s the furthest thing from the truth. This is the nicest bag I’ve ever touched, and I’ve got 30 $400-$1000+ bags in my office.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love a spinner
reviews.reviewText: Got this on to replace same-sized model and brand roller bag. The new model has popup expansion that is so easy to use! The spinner wheels don’t always roll straight, but quality and durability is great. Handle is much more durable than Tumi of same size.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Everything I was looking for
reviews.reviewText: Only used it locally so far. Pockets are everything I was looking for. High quality material and zippers, which were an issue with comparable bags.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Love the design, hate the wheels. It won't roll straight!
reviews.reviewText: i took the time to evaluate 6 different 21-22" spinner bags before settling on this one. Of course I was not able to take all 6 bags through the airport, but i figured that any spinner would work just like my existing $199 Samsonite spinner. Um, no.It has good room for packing and the expandable feature is much better than other bags. Having the handle on the outside of the bag makes the interior packing space completely flat on the bottom. no more uneven "channels" in the bottom of the case.The most annoying - and it is VERY annoying - is fighting the case while wheeling it through an airport. You start walking and it heads in one direction. Then you adjust it a bit and it heads in a different direction. Twist the bag a bit and then it heads another direction. You have to CONSTANTLY adjust the direction because it WILL NOT GO STRAIGHT.I've taken it on 2 trips so far - and it can handle the weight and dense packing. Even so, if you want to be able to effortlessly navigate through an airport with this bag, you will be disappointed. for a $700 price tag, someone in the B&R design department should have figured out how to make the bag easy to wheel through the airport.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Spinner made.
reviews.reviewText: When I got my first B&R roll-aboard I thought was the best roll-aboard made. Had it 16(?) years now, still looks brand-new, but I think the spinner upgrade with the compression sides and improved suit storage is actually even better!Even Tumi, long the best, cannot beat Briggs & Riley (Ironically, both are now sister companies!).The only drawback? It's ridiculously expensive but given my history with the 2-wheeler, I expect to have it a long, long time. (Travel Pro and Delsey are excellent less-expensive alternatives)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Flawed wheel design. Difficult to maneuver.
reviews.reviewText: This is my 6th B&R bag in the last 20 years, and the 2nd generation of this 22" baseline spinner. I like the rugged design of these bags and the warranty service of the past, but my experience with this bag has me considering Tumi.The previous generation had different sized wheels in the front and back which caused it to tip and pull slightly in one direction and caused me to wonder how B&R's product team could have possible released this design. Clearly they didn't have feedback from frequent travelers. This gen has the same sized wheels, but has very narrow and tall caster spindles that mount to flexible points on the bag. The result is wheels that shift to odd angles that are out of alignment and cause the bag to randomly pull in different directions.This is a totally flawed design that cannot be repaired by warranty service. When I've demonstrated this issue at the local authorized repair center, they're perplexed and have no solutions. When I report to customer service, they simply want me to sent them the bag to replace the wheels with the same flawed design. They have not designed a retrofit to resolve this issue, so it won't fixed until some future generation of the bag, if at all.I would highly recommend waiting for a future generation of this bag and then testing the maneuverability after overstuffing or manually flexing the wheels into alternate angles to simulate wear and tear during years of handling.The other issue that you might notice with these bags is the excessive play in the telescoping handle. B&R uses a thin, lightweight material for the 3 telescoping sections that results in more movement that I like when fully extended.B&R has the potential to design and build a world-class bag, but their R&D needs more work and feedback from frequent travelers with B&R experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great rollerboard to carry-on
reviews.reviewText: I just upgraded my hard sided luggage, which was great in its day, to B&R. I'm happy I did. I like the funcitonality of outside pockets. And this bag rolls and moves like a dream. My old bag was designed to do the same, but would tire my wrists after a bit. This does not have that effect at all. It's a pleasure to move about. I do wish there was a grab handle on both sides, but no big deal. This is the first bag I've gotten that opens on the top vs. in the midline, and I think I like that too. I've used the garment section yet, but it's a nice feature.Also love the navy color - very classy!

reviews.reviewTitle: Briggs & Riley Global Carry-on: Splurged on a Bargain Crown Jewel!
reviews.reviewText: The Briggs & Riley Unisex-Adult Global Carry-on is the royalty of carry-on luggage, and let's face it, it comes with a princely price tag. Initially, my wallet clutched its pearls in sheer horror, but lo and behold, the stars aligned, and I snagged it on sale. It's like winning the luggage lottery – the kind of deal that has you doing a victory dance in the living room. The quality, my friends, is nothing short of a castle in the air. The spinner wheels glide like they've been trained at a luggage Olympics, and the ballistic nylon is so rugged that I'm convinced it moonlights as a superhero cape when I'm not looking.The attention to detail is superb, from the self-repairing YKK zippers to the cavernous interior that seems to have a magical expansion charm. It's like Mary Poppins had a hand in the design, ensuring that everything fits neatly and stylishly. However, even with the sale, the cost made my budget cough up a little protest. It's the kind of splurge that makes you want to whisper sweet budget reassurances to your bank account. But hey, when you're strutting through the airport like a luggage monarch, the price seems to fade into the background – until the credit card statement arrives.In conclusion, Briggs & Riley's Global Carry-on is the Cinderella slipper of luggage – expensive, but when you catch it on sale, it fits like a dream. Four stars for making me feel like luggage royalty without entirely depleting my royal treasury. It's like having a suitcase that says, "I may be pricey, but I'm worth it." 👜🌟
Best quality luggage out there. - From a person who travels every few weeks and owns the collection.Remember to register for the lifetime warranty.

I had purchased a Briggs and Riley wheeled carry-on and overnight bag a number of years ago at a high-end luggage store. When I needed a larger bag, I couldn’t find a match locally. Enter Amazon. They had the exact bag I needed. I’ve done a fair amount of travelling and they still look like new. They’re extremely durable (great zippers and reinforced corners), lots of pockets, easy to manoeuvre and they look classy. They are a bit more expensive, but you’re definitely paying for a high quality product. I doubt I’ll ever need to replace these.
Excellent quality. Size for regulation carry-on.
Very well made product that looks great and works well. Works very well as an accessory to the larger Briggs and Riley suitcases. Highly recommended.
